definition: building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: The hotel is in front of the post office.
I don't think he will jump his hotel bill.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他不会不付旅馆账单就溜掉的。

sentences.english: I'm afraid the hOtel's full on those dates.
sentences.chinese: 那几天逸旅馆恐怕都客满了。

sentences.english: Blue sky to secure them, Yin three hid in the hotel yard.
sentences.chinese: 为保安全，尹三将蓝天藏在旅馆后院里。

sentences.english: They booked us into a tuppeny-ha'penny hotel near the docks.
sentences.chinese: 他们为我们在离码头不远处订了个廉价旅馆。

sentences.english: The hotel charged 150 dollors a day,the meal is not included.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆一天收费一百五十美元，不包括膳食。

sentences.english: I'm Edwin. I'll show you to your hotel.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱德温，我带你去旅馆。

sentences.english: Is it customary for guests at hotels in your country to tip the waiters?
sentences.chinese: 在贵国住旅馆的客人依惯例是否给侍者小费。

sentences.english: E. G. 1 Hotel accommodation was scarce during the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 奥运会期间，旅馆房间很难找。

sentences.english: Of course. Every hotel depends upon the repute of its patrons.
sentences.chinese: 当然啦，每家旅馆都要依靠其主顾的名声。

sentences.english: How shall I set myself down in the hotel register?
sentences.chinese: 在旅馆的登记簿上，我应如何写自己的身份呢？

sentences.english: The hotel has special facilities for welcoming disabled people.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆有专供残疾人使用的设施。

sentences.english: The hotel has been redecorated, but it lost a lot of it's style.
sentences.chinese: 旅馆已重新装修，但昔日优雅格调所剩不多。

sentences.english: He looked through the hotel advertisements until one of them took his fancy.
sentences.chinese: 他查遍旅馆广告，直到有一家中了他的意。

sentences.english: The merchants lied at a caravanserai that night.
sentences.chinese: 商人们那天晚上在商队旅馆过夜。

sentences.english: Television is available in each of the hotel rooms as an extra.
sentences.chinese: 旅馆每个房间都有电视机作为额外优待。
